Expert testimony: Russian literature experts confirmed that the poem written by Aung San Suu Kyi was not borrowed from Vladimir Mayakovsky, refuting the claim of plagiarism.
Social media circulation: The claim was published on Facebook and has been shared around 1,200 times, indicating its spread on social media platforms.
Translation of the Burmese post: The translated part of the Burmese-language post mentioned that the poem sold at auction was a copy of a Russian poem, suggesting the claim of plagiarism.
Composite image and accompanying details: The composite image shared alongside the claim included a stock photo of Vladimir Mayakovsky, Russian language text stating his birthdate, and a photograph of a Russian-language book. These details were used to support the claim but did not provide concrete evidence of plagiarism.
